page.title: 01Ewerby Waithe Common & Fen
page.content: An area of open Fen with a few small copses of decidious trees. The land is divided into large fields by drainage ditches and a few hedges alongside the road. The crops are sugarbeet, potatoes, grain, oilseed rape & Peas. The public road,(its has a 3 tonne weight restriction), from Ewerby Thorpe to Halfpenny Hatch provides access to the fields. Part of the Sleaford-Skegness road, (built of concrete on a bank avove the Few) runs through squares 1 & 2. The few farms & dwellings are very isolated. The river Slea runs through the block from east to west. In the past it was embanked as a canal but is now only used for land drainage; although a preservation society is attempting to reopen this stretch for pleasure boating.
